Introduction

We are excited to start the 5th edition of the newsletter for the year 2011 with two accolades of our members. Mrs. Kamalambal Vedanarayanan has been recognised with Brent Community Champions award for her long and outstanding community service to the people of the Borough. Master Gorak Rajesh a 9 year old gifted child has been invited to represent England in Under-10 section of the World Youth Chess Championships. Hearty congratulations from all of us to both Mrs. Kamalambal and Master Gorak for their achievement so far and wishing Master Gorak success in all the future tournaments to come.

Sponsors

We are pleased to announce that HDFC London, has agreed to be one of the sponsors for South Indian Society London. We look forward for a long standing relationship with HDFC London.

Forthcoming Events

The next Monthly Meeting will be held on Sunday the 12th of June between 1-4 p.m. at Saiva Munnetra Sangam No.2 Salisbury Road, Manor Park, E12 6AB. Mr. Balasubramanian will be leading a Sampradhaya Bhajanai. It would be a splendid satsangam and we assure you a very divine atmosphere in Sri Natarajar temple.

Following the grand success of the SIS Cricket at Event last year, we have scheduled to hold this year's cricket event on the Saturday 9th of July at Recreation Ground, Pinner Road, harrow, Middlesex, HA1 1PB. We are planning to have league matches between three teams, to decide the winning team. We are getting great response for this year as well. In order to organise well and plan better, we request you to send in your participation and your area of expertise in cricket (could be bowling, batting, wicket keeping, umpiring or all of them) as soon as possible.

We are organising a upanyasam in August by a learned scholar who is trained to perform upanyasam in Sri Anantharama Dikshadar style. Details to follow.

Please block your calendar for all SIS events. Details of all the events are available under the Events Section on the website. As we update them with details of events as and when they are finalised, please keep visiting the Nambalava website. Members are requested to attend these meetings and send in their much valued feedback and suggestions.

The Website

As you may have already noticed, we are taking all possible efforts to provide interesting and useful articles on the website www.sisnambalava.org.uk We are encouraged by the number of visits on our website globally, which is only increasing multi-fold every month. This month, we have uploaded interesting articles about Vaikasi Visakam with some wonderful photographs of temples, some articles to kindle your thought like "Why me?", "Where there is a will, there is a way" etc. Please visit the website, read the articles and let us know your views. We also welcome articles from all our members. The articles will be uploaded after review by the editorial panel.

Success of Charity Drive so far

As you are aware, SIS committee initiated a charity drive to support Raja Veda Patasala in Kumbakonam, one of the oldest Veda Patasalas in India dating back to 1542. We are extremely pleased that we have collected over £600 so far. We have set ourselves an aggressive target of £5000/- for this year. We are committed to this cause and wish to assure you that the entire proceeds from this charity drive will be donated to the Veda Patasala once the target is achieved, or at least when the amount collected is close to the target, so that they could use this as corpus amount and get return from this for their expenses. We will keep you informed periodically. The Committee requests you all to donate generously to this noble cause. You can easily transfer the money as a lump sum to be added to the corpus amount or set up standing order through your bank to the following SIS account:

Name: South Indian Society
Sort Code: 20-29-37
Account No. 50284645
Ref: Patasala

Please do not forget to mention ‘Patasala’ in the reference section of the transfer form. For more information on the Patasala please visit www.rajapatasala.in

May we request those of you who have not yet paid (£20), please do so at the earliest. South Indian Society as an organisation has come to shape with lots of hard work and contribution from several veterans of our community in this country. We sincerely thank each and every one who has contributed towards the growth of this organisation. This organisation runs for YOU and without YOUR involvement, contribution and participation it cannot succeed.

Enjoy the Summer and see you all this weekend (12th of June) in the satsangam.
